name: shortcut_get-current-user
description: Get the current user

name: shortcut_get-current-user-teams
description: Get a list of teams where the current user is a member

name: shortcut_list-users
description: Get all users

name: shortcut_get-story
description: Get a Shortcut story by public ID

storyPublicId.description: The public ID of the story to get

full.description: True to return all story fields from the API. False to return a slim version that excludes uncommon fields

name: shortcut_search-stories
description: Find Shortcut stories.

nextPageToken.description: If a next_page_token was returned from the search result, pass it in to get the next page of results. Should be combined with the original search parameters.

id.description: Find only stories with the specified public ID

name.description: Find only stories matching the specified name

description.description: Find only stories matching the specified description

comment.description: Find only stories matching the specified comment

type.description: Find only stories of the specified type

estimate.description: Find only stories matching the specified estimate

branch.description: Find only stories matching the specified branch

commit.description: Find only stories matching the specified commit

pr.description: Find only stories matching the specified pull request

project.description: Find only stories matching the specified project

epic.description: Find only stories matching the specified epic

objective.description: Find only stories matching the specified objective

state.description: Find only stories matching the specified state

label.description: Find only stories matching the specified label

owner.description: Find entities where the owner match the specified user. This must either be the user's mention name or the keyword "me" for the current user.

requester.description: Find entities where the requester match the specified user. This must either be the user's mention name or the keyword "me" for the current user.

team.description: Find only stories matching the specified team. This can be a team mention name or team name.

skillSet.description: Find only stories matching the specified skill set

productArea.description: Find only stories matching the specified product area

technicalArea.description: Find only stories matching the specified technical area

priority.description: Find only stories matching the specified priority

severity.description: Find only stories matching the specified severity

isDone.description: Find only entities that are completed when true, or only entities that are not completed when false.

isStarted.description: Find only entities that are started when true, or only entities that are not started when false.

isUnstarted.description: Find only entities that are unstarted when true, or only entities that are not unstarted when false.

isUnestimated.description: Find only entities that are unestimated when true, or only entities that are not unestimated when false.

isOverdue.description: Find only entities that are overdue when true, or only entities that are not overdue when false.

isArchived.description: Find only entities that are archived when true, or only entities that are not archived when false.

isBlocker.description: Find only entities that are blocking when true, or only entities that are not blocking when false.

isBlocked.description: Find only entities that are blocked when true, or only entities that are not blocked when false.

hasComment.description: Find only entities that have a comment when true, or only entities that do not have a comment when false. Example: hasOwner: true will find stories with an owner, hasOwner: false will find stories without an owner.

hasLabel.description: Find only entities that have a label when true, or only entities that do not have a label when false. Example: hasOwner: true will find stories with an owner, hasOwner: false will find stories without an owner.

hasDeadline.description: Find only entities that have a deadline when true, or only entities that do not have a deadline when false. Example: hasOwner: true will find stories with an owner, hasOwner: false will find stories without an owner.

hasOwner.description: Find only entities that have an owner when true, or only entities that do not have an owner when false. Example: hasOwner: true will find stories with an owner, hasOwner: false will find stories without an owner.

hasPr.description: Find only entities that have a pr when true, or only entities that do not have a pr when false. Example: hasOwner: true will find stories with an owner, hasOwner: false will find stories without an owner.

hasCommit.description: Find only entities that have a commit when true, or only entities that do not have a commit when false. Example: hasOwner: true will find stories with an owner, hasOwner: false will find stories without an owner.

hasBranch.description: Find only entities that have a branch when true, or only entities that do not have a branch when false. Example: hasOwner: true will find stories with an owner, hasOwner: false will find stories without an owner.

hasEpic.description: Find only entities that have an epic when true, or only entities that do not have an epic when false. Example: hasOwner: true will find stories with an owner, hasOwner: false will find stories without an owner.

hasTask.description: Find only entities that have a task when true, or only entities that do not have a task when false. Example: hasOwner: true will find stories with an owner, hasOwner: false will find stories without an owner.

hasAttachment.description: Find only entities that have an attachment when true, or only entities that do not have an attachment when false. Example: hasOwner: true will find stories with an owner, hasOwner: false will find stories without an owner.

created.description: The date in "YYYY-MM-DD" format, or one of the keywords: "yesterday", "today", "tomorrow", or a date range in the format "YYYY-MM-DD..YYYY-MM-DD". The date range can also be open ended by using "*" for one of the bounds. Examples: "2023-01-01", "today", "2023-01-01..*" (from Jan 1, 2023 to any future date), "*.2023-01-31" (any date up to Jan 31, 2023), "today..*" (from today onwards), "*.yesterday" (any date up to yesterday). The keywords cannot be used to calculate relative dates (e.g. the following are not valid: "today-1" or "tomorrow+1").

updated.description: The date in "YYYY-MM-DD" format, or one of the keywords: "yesterday", "today", "tomorrow", or a date range in the format "YYYY-MM-DD..YYYY-MM-DD". The date range can also be open ended by using "*" for one of the bounds. Examples: "2023-01-01", "today", "2023-01-01..*" (from Jan 1, 2023 to any future date), "*.2023-01-31" (any date up to Jan 31, 2023), "today..*" (from today onwards), "*.yesterday" (any date up to yesterday). The keywords cannot be used to calculate relative dates (e.g. the following are not valid: "today-1" or "tomorrow+1").

completed.description: The date in "YYYY-MM-DD" format, or one of the keywords: "yesterday", "today", "tomorrow", or a date range in the format "YYYY-MM-DD..YYYY-MM-DD". The date range can also be open ended by using "*" for one of the bounds. Examples: "2023-01-01", "today", "2023-01-01..*" (from Jan 1, 2023 to any future date), "*.2023-01-31" (any date up to Jan 31, 2023), "today..*" (from today onwards), "*.yesterday" (any date up to yesterday). The keywords cannot be used to calculate relative dates (e.g. the following are not valid: "today-1" or "tomorrow+1").

due.description: The date in "YYYY-MM-DD" format, or one of the keywords: "yesterday", "today", "tomorrow", or a date range in the format "YYYY-MM-DD..YYYY-MM-DD". The date range can also be open ended by using "*" for one of the bounds. Examples: "2023-01-01", "today", "2023-01-01..*" (from Jan 1, 2023 to any future date), "*.2023-01-31" (any date up to Jan 31, 2023), "today..*" (from today onwards), "*.yesterday" (any date up to yesterday). The keywords cannot be used to calculate relative dates (e.g. the following are not valid: "today-1" or "tomorrow+1").

name: shortcut_get-story-branch-name
description: Get a valid branch name for a specific story.

storyPublicId.description: The public Id of the story

name: shortcut_create-story
description:
Create a new Shortcut story. 
Name is required, and either a Team or Workflow must be specified:
- If only Team is specified, we will use the default workflow for that team.
- If Workflow is specified, it will be used regardless of Team.
The story will be added to the default state for the workflow.

name.description: The name of the story. Required.

owner.description: The user id of the owner of the story

epic.description: The epic id of the epic the story belongs to

iteration.description: The iteration id of the iteration the story belongs to

team.description: The team ID or mention name of the team the story belongs to. Required unless a workflow is specified.

workflow.description: The workflow ID to add the story to. Required unless a team is specified.

name: shortcut_update-story
description: Update an existing Shortcut story. Only provide fields you want to update. The story public ID will always be included in updates.

storyPublicId.description: The public ID of the story to update

epic.description: The epic id of the epic the story belongs to, or null to unset

estimate.description: The point estimate of the story, or null to unset

iteration.description: The iteration id of the iteration the story belongs to, or null to unset

owner_ids.description: Array of user UUIDs to assign as owners of the story

workflow_state_id.description: The workflow state ID to move the story to

labels.description: Labels to assign to the story

name: shortcut_upload-file-to-story
description: Upload a file and link it to a story.

storyPublicId.description: The public ID of the story

filePath.description: The path to the file to upload

name: shortcut_assign-current-user-as-owner
description: Assign the current user as the owner of a story

storyPublicId.description: The public ID of the story

name: shortcut_unassign-current-user-as-owner
description: Unassign the current user as the owner of a story

storyPublicId.description: The public ID of the story

name: shortcut_create-story-comment
description: Create a comment on a story

storyPublicId.description: The public ID of the story

name: shortcut_add-task-to-story
description: Add a task to a story

storyPublicId.description: The public ID of the story

taskOwnerIds.description: Array of user IDs to assign as owners of the task

name: shortcut_update-task
description: Update a task in a story

storyPublicId.description: The public ID of the story

taskPublicId.description: The public ID of the task

taskOwnerIds.description: Array of user IDs to assign as owners of the task

isCompleted.description: Whether the task is completed or not

name: shortcut_add-relation-to-story
description: Add a story relationship to a story

storyPublicId.description: The public ID of the story

relatedStoryPublicId.description: The public ID of the related story

name: shortcut_add-external-link-to-story
description: Add an external link to a Shortcut story

storyPublicId.description: The public ID of the story

externalLink.description: The external link URL to add

name: shortcut_remove-external-link-from-story
description: Remove an external link from a Shortcut story

storyPublicId.description: The public ID of the story

externalLink.description: The external link URL to remove

name: shortcut_set-story-external-links
description: Replace all external links on a story with a new set of links

storyPublicId.description: The public ID of the story

externalLinks.description: Array of external link URLs to set (replaces all existing links)

name: shortcut_get-stories-by-external-link
description: Find all stories that contain a specific external link

externalLink.description: The external link URL to search for

name: shortcut_get-iteration-stories
description: Get stories in a specific iteration by iteration public ID

iterationPublicId.description: The public ID of the iteration

includeStoryDescriptions.description: Indicate whether story descriptions should be included. Including descriptions may take longer and will increase the size of the response.

name: shortcut_get-iteration
description: Get a Shortcut iteration by public ID

iterationPublicId.description: The public ID of the iteration to get

full.description: True to return all iteration fields from the API. False to return a slim version that excludes uncommon fields

name: shortcut_search-iterations
description: Find Shortcut iterations.

nextPageToken.description: If a next_page_token was returned from the search result, pass it in to get the next page of results. Should be combined with the original search parameters.

id.description: Find only iterations with the specified public ID

name.description: Find only iterations matching the specified name

description.description: Find only iterations matching the specified description

state.description: Find only iterations matching the specified state

team.description: Find only iterations matching the specified team. This can be a team ID or mention name.

created.description: The date in "YYYY-MM-DD" format, or one of the keywords: "yesterday", "today", "tomorrow", or a date range in the format "YYYY-MM-DD..YYYY-MM-DD". The date range can also be open ended by using "*" for one of the bounds. Examples: "2023-01-01", "today", "2023-01-01..*" (from Jan 1, 2023 to any future date), "*.2023-01-31" (any date up to Jan 31, 2023), "today..*" (from today onwards), "*.yesterday" (any date up to yesterday). The keywords cannot be used to calculate relative dates (e.g. the following are not valid: "today-1" or "tomorrow+1").

updated.description: The date in "YYYY-MM-DD" format, or one of the keywords: "yesterday", "today", "tomorrow", or a date range in the format "YYYY-MM-DD..YYYY-MM-DD". The date range can also be open ended by using "*" for one of the bounds. Examples: "2023-01-01", "today", "2023-01-01..*" (from Jan 1, 2023 to any future date), "*.2023-01-31" (any date up to Jan 31, 2023), "today..*" (from today onwards), "*.yesterday" (any date up to yesterday). The keywords cannot be used to calculate relative dates (e.g. the following are not valid: "today-1" or "tomorrow+1").

startDate.description: The date in "YYYY-MM-DD" format, or one of the keywords: "yesterday", "today", "tomorrow", or a date range in the format "YYYY-MM-DD..YYYY-MM-DD". The date range can also be open ended by using "*" for one of the bounds. Examples: "2023-01-01", "today", "2023-01-01..*" (from Jan 1, 2023 to any future date), "*.2023-01-31" (any date up to Jan 31, 2023), "today..*" (from today onwards), "*.yesterday" (any date up to yesterday). The keywords cannot be used to calculate relative dates (e.g. the following are not valid: "today-1" or "tomorrow+1").

endDate.description: The date in "YYYY-MM-DD" format, or one of the keywords: "yesterday", "today", "tomorrow", or a date range in the format "YYYY-MM-DD..YYYY-MM-DD". The date range can also be open ended by using "*" for one of the bounds. Examples: "2023-01-01", "today", "2023-01-01..*" (from Jan 1, 2023 to any future date), "*.2023-01-31" (any date up to Jan 31, 2023), "today..*" (from today onwards), "*.yesterday" (any date up to yesterday). The keywords cannot be used to calculate relative dates (e.g. the following are not valid: "today-1" or "tomorrow+1").

name: shortcut_create-iteration
description: Create a new Shortcut iteration

startDate.description: The start date of the iteration in YYYY-MM-DD format

endDate.description: The end date of the iteration in YYYY-MM-DD format

teamId.description: The ID of a team to assign the iteration to

name: shortcut_get-active-iterations
description: Get the active Shortcut iterations for the current user based on their team memberships

teamId.description: The ID of a team to filter iterations by

description: List all Shortcut teams

name: shortcut_get-default-workflow
description: Get the default workflow for a specific team or the global default if no team is specified.

teamPublicId.description: The public ID of the team to get the default workflow for.

name: shortcut_create-document
description:
Create a new document in Shortcut with a title and content. Returns the document's id, title, and app_url. Note: Use HTML markup for the content (e.g.,

,

,
    , ) rather than Markdown.

title.description: The title for the new document (max 256 characters)

content.description:
The content for the new document in HTML format (e.g.,

Hello

,

Title

,
  • Item
)
